intro: Geonoma werdermannii, commonly known as the Werdermann's fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features intricate, pinnate fronds with a delicate, feathery appearance. It typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky surfaces, showcasing its adaptability to various substrates. Its botanical significance lies in its role within tropical ecosystems and its value in horticultural collections.
